title: Timucuan Ecological & Historic Preserve: Kingsley Plantation
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Places     Kingsley Plantation                 Kingsley Plantation      During the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries, many people came to Florida. Some, like Zephaniah Kingsley, sought to make their fortunes by obtaining land and establishing plantations. Others were forced to come to Florida to work on those plantations, their labor providing wealth to the people who owned them. Some of the enslaved would later become free landowners, struggling to keep their footing in a dangerous time of shifting alliances and politics. All of these people played a part in the history of Kingsley Plantation.   Visiting Kingsley Plantation History of Kingsley Plantation  Â      Visiting the Park           Audio Tour The Lion's Storyteller    The Kingsley Plantation audio tour "The Lion's Story Teller" provides visitors with an immersive experience of the past.           History Comes to Life Events   Check out our calendar to find out what fun living history, citizen science and volunteer events we have coming up.            Inside the Planter's Home Weekend House Tours   Weekend tours are available on a limited basis at 11:00 a.m. and 3 p.m.          Finding Your Park Directions    We are located at 11676 Palmetto Ave. Jacksonville, FL          Investigating a Tabby Slave Cabin Project Archaeology Teacher Workshop   This free workshop is offered July 14th and 15th.  Reservations are still available.           Freedom and Enslavement The People of Kingsley Plantation   Discover the stories from the past.
